website_summaries.verdict: The Nikon D5200 makes a great choice for family and vacation photographers.
pros: With excellent photo and video quality for its class, a fluid shooting design and solid feature set, the Nikon D5200 delivers a lot for the money
cons: Though it has no significant flaws, the lack of an autofocus motor in the body limits your lens-selection flexibility

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a beginner who wants to learn the ins and outs of photography (use manual mode!!)
customer_reviews.text: This camera has served me very well. I have been using it for 4 years straight with amazing results. As I have progressed as a photographer, I have realized that there are certain situations which really call for more some of the features offered in higher end models than this, but I would definitely suggest this (or any of the newer models of this) camera to anyone who is just starting to feel serious about learning photography. This camera is a great instrument to learn with. The articulating screen (it can actually pull out and swing around, not just tilt up and down) has proven to be amazingly useful for astrophotography, macro shots, self portraits, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: Better than advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this D5200 Nikon Camera body as a replacement for my D5100, which was damaged. I am extremely pleased with it. The item lising said it was "Used - Very Good Condition". Upon receipt, inspection and testing, I cannot tell it from brand new. It is absolutely perfect and all functions are 100%. Delivery was prompt and packaging was excellent. I am extremely pleased with the the D5200 and would highly recommend DJT World (seller). Further, although it said it was "body Only" it came with a Nikon strap, battery and battery charger.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Has Been Perfect For Son's Sport Photos
customer_reviews.text: Our son is fourteen and plays multiple sports - we lived without a good camera for a long time. Amazon had a great no interest financing on cameras if minimum payments were made with the Amazon card so we bought this as a family Christmas gift. The camera takes great pictures - especially during my son's soccer matches and uploading photos is extremely easy. The battery life is fantastic - and I even like the red color I chose. My favorite feature is being able to zoom, crop and position the photos (with multiple size ratios from 1x1 to a 16x9 widescreen) within the camera view screen - the options are even better than photo viewers found on my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Chris and Cara Mandart

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D5200
customer_reviews.text: It's my first professional camera, was analyzing various brands before choosing, I am very satisfied with the Nikon D5200 camera, brings many advantages over other brands, is a lightweight camera, compact, effective when taking pictures, use friendly the menus, photographic effects are great, I'm amazed I'm exploring the utility for this camera, I am actually very happy and satisfied with this product and this brand of camera respectively dsrl. I recommend it for beginners, intermediates and experts can actually take much advantage to all camera functions so I give it 5 stars, soon will begin to acquire new lenses to expand my horizons in photography.
customer_reviews.author: jose

customer_reviews.title: The camera itself is really easy to use and the learning curve of how to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera after weighing it against a D5300 and the D7000, and I think that I have made the right choice. The feature difference between this camera and the D5300 is not worth the price gap in my opinion, instead I spent that extra money on accessories and another lens. The camera itself is really easy to use and the learning curve of how to use all of its features is fairly steady. I've owned my D5200 for 5 months now and will update my review as I continue to learn about more things I can do with the camera daily.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D5200
customer_reviews.text: The camera is a step up from the trusty Canon Powershot A610 that I have had for years. I wanted to step up to a DSLR and after reading reviews I chose the Nikon over the comparable Canon. I have just begun to learn the capabilities of the camera. Even in auto mode the image quality is fine. I shot video of my son's wedding and was impressed with the picture quality although an external microphone would have been useful. Amazon had the right price and the reputation of standing behind the sale that made my choice to purchase from them rather than the many other options available. A $100 rebate on an additional Nikon lens also was a factor.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice basic DSLR
customer_reviews.text: This makes a great introductory camera. I have gotten many pictures that I am proud of with this camera. I see this camera as a good beginner's camera or casual point and shoot. If you think you will be wanting to get your hands on a nicer camera with more bells and whistles down the road, I would consider looking at getting a D7100 or D7200 instead. It might be harder to learn all the dials and buttons at first. I outgrew this camera fast I feel so if you predict that happening, go the next step up from here
customer_reviews.author: ABigFan

customer_reviews.title: Really great kit!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic kit well worth the money! Has all of the essentials! The lenses have terrific range for the starter. I LOVE that my old-school nikkor F stop lenses fit and work with my new camera, but--of course!--without the auto features. This is ideal for the intermediate to advanced amateur who doesn't want to go all out into the next price range. I feel like Ralphie Parker in a A Christmas Story dreaming about all of the great stuff I'm going to do with my new Red Rider Beebee Gun/Camera!
customer_reviews.author: butterfliegel

customer_reviews.title: Birthday/Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: My children and my wife got together and supplied the purchase of a camera that I had been drooling over for the past several months. One son is a very serious amateur photographer and owns several Nikons. This camera is somewhat a challenge with all the menus and buttons, but having used one of his early Nikons, I'm not totally lost. The pictures that I have taken for Christmas and other events have produced photos that far exceed anything I have taken with my Point and Shoot cameras and also the early Nikon. Would advise anyone moving into a serious DSLR to consider this camera
customer_reviews.author: Katman01

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this camera
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this camera! Very user friendly, and easy to operate. Watched the included DVD, and got started. Reading up on how to properly use aperture and all the other settings were a must, but the AUTO option works just as great. This is my first DSLR and have been very happy with the quality. The included bag has held up and there are plenty of compartments for everything. Lens are your general "kit" lens as they call them, but since I am a beginner and not looking to become a professional photographer any time soon, this camera was perfect, and the price is comparable to others I have found locally.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great starting DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Got this as my first DSLR camera, and it has been fantastic. Nikon makes some quality cameras and the D5200 has a great balance of photo and video quality for under $1000 with a decent variable or prime lens. More than enough presets and forgiving auto modes for a beginner as well as full manual shooting. The focus is a bit loud on the 18-55mm VR lens during video with the camera's built in mic. I'd strongly recommend a lens hood for the kit lens, and certainly at least one prime lens if you are just beginning with DSLRs.
customer_reviews.author: M. Grenda

customer_reviews.title: Terrific first step into the DSLR market
customer_reviews.text: Full function digital camera - it is easy to use, takes great pictures and has more than enough options to suit someone who's looking for a step up to a point and shoot. Even using the camera as a point and shoot I have taken some amazing photos - it works pretty well as a video camera as well, though by default the video resolution is very high and takes up a ton of space - the only drawback aside from that is the placement of the microphone - it's right by the lens, so if you use the auto focus feature, the mic picks up the sound of the lens motors. Manual focus would avoid this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jen H

customer_reviews.title: Words cannot describe how happy I am with this
customer_reviews.text: The subject says it all. I've been going back and forth about this camera for over a year now. I am very pleased I finally got it. It takes fantastic pictures, AND it works with all my old lenses. The catch with the old lenses is that they don't auto focus during the videos. I'll apparently need to get a new digital SLR lens that will auto focus properly for me. I want it mostly for vacation pictures and videos so I don't really need to have the absolute control over the focus when I'm taking a video
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera after using a D3100 for a few years. I LOVE that this camera has a flip out screen. It makes it super easy to film myself for vlogs or take self portraits, whereas with the D3100, I had to guess where I was in the frame. Camera works super well with a remote and tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Wolcott

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as my first step into DSLR. It is a fantastic price as it is not the newest model in this line, but it is still a wonderful camera. It's complex and has all the manual control I could want, but I didn't have to break the bank to buy it. I've already dropped it a few times because I'm just that person and it has no effect on it. I don't suggest throwing or a football but it's not the most delicate camera I've eve owned either.
customer_reviews.author: Alex ReganHolzheimer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase as a bundle.
customer_reviews.text: My first DSLR. Im on cloud 9! This was a great buy. My pictures now look as good as the ones I see in magazines, I'm just not getting paid. HD video-Amazing! So many features/capabilities I'm not sure I'll ever become familiar with them all. I love being able to point and shoot on the fly and capture smiles or funny moments with pristine focus and quality without waiting too long and I miss the moment. I'm no professional but I believe this is one of he best DSLRs an amateur could own.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good value for high quality filming
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a Canon guy, but recently decided to try out Nikon. The D5200 has become a great,reliable backup camera for me. It's lightweight, takes high quality images and full HD video up to 60i which is great for moving images. There isn't much noise even at high ISOs. My only gripe is that it is harder to adjust settings using the buttons and scroll wheels, so you are forced to enter menus to make fine changes that could be more easily be done on my Canons. However, even for a main camera, not just a backup, I can still recommend the D5200.
customer_reviews.author: FilmPro

customer_reviews.title: My BIGGEST purchase on amazon, but my best purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Flat out awesome camera! Nothing else I can say. It is so worth the price and this kit is a total steal!!!! LOVE LOVE LOVE it! I spent hours, days actually, comparing this to the Canon T5i and to other lesser Nikons like the D3200 and 3300. After a lot of deliberation I decided to just ball out and go big. I am so happy with my choice. All people even remotely considering getting a DSLR should just suck it up and get this one!!!
customer_reviews.author: Derek Guzman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pro-sumer camera.
customer_reviews.text: i was skeptical about the Nikon DXxxx series of cameras. I enjoyed cameras such as the A6000, Canon 60D, and older Nikon D80/D90. However, the D5200 handles nicely. It has features that I am used with other bodies. I would have liked a top LCD but otherwise controls are good. The camera focuses quickly and shooting is a breeze. The VF on this series of cameras is a tad small, I handled a D600/610 and they have nice and bright VF;s. Thankfully Nikon has excellent lens selection.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Love this starter/intermediate DSLR
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty easy to use DSLR with nice features that takes really lovely photos. I bought it for work purposes but find myself pulling it out to play with quite often. I bought the bundle with the bag and zoom lens and they're a great value! The bag is padded and does the job quite well and the zoom lens is a nice starter model (not a telephoto zoom by any stretch of the imagination but gets you a bit closer). I've added a couple pics I took.
customer_reviews.author: E. A. Stafford

customer_reviews.title: Best for beginners progressing to advance photographers.
customer_reviews.text: Took it on my first trip to LA. Amazing camera, a great upgrade compared to my old camera which was really old. The camera is lighter than most DSLR, smaller too so it comes in really handy. The 55m lens is great for almost everything so its more than enough for beginners. Overall, I believe this is the best valued DSLR camera for beginners to progress into advance photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Jia Jian Tin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR camera so while I will admit that I do not have a lot of photography experience but I must say I love this camera. I have nothing negative to say about it. I take it with me everywhere I go and have even expanded into a small photo business with it because of my love for the wonderful job it does. Again I am not a pro by any means so I could be missing comments about the deep tech talk of it all but I personally would recommend this camera to anyone looking for a great DSLR camera!
customer_reviews.author: Fred Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera -
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera!!! - very easy to use interface, quick on the fly. Kit lenses are ok for everyday photos, but you'll definitely be shopping for upgrades if you want to see what shots your really capable of with this camera. WU-1A Wireless adapter is a solid performer, have used it with good success with both my android cell phone and Samsung Galaxy Note 4 tablet when hooked to a tripod for stabilizing my shots. This one will definitely be staying in my bag for several years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan W. Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, easy to use, packed with features
customer_reviews.text: A exceptional camera for photographing sports and low-light settings! I purchased this camera to photograph and video tape my children's sports events. The Nikon D5200 delivered on the action photography and captured balls leaving the bats and soccer balls contacting the foot. The D5200 captures clean images even in low light. Multiple auto settings makes it a easy and fast to use while the manual setting help put you in charge of the outcome. I highly recommend this camera for action shots -- it has served me well.
customer_reviews.author: Beau

customer_reviews.title: Leary.
customer_reviews.text: Camera was supposed to be New. At this point I'm highly doubting it but I will let a camera repair store make the final decision. The camera body was clean and the lens appears New but the internals were filthy. Dust dirt and fingerprints on the mirrors. This is my 4th Nikon and I broke my other D5200 so I am very familiar with them. The packets containing all the books etc were sealed but not like it would be from the factory and the box lid was taped back shut with packaging tape over the factory type seal. Leary of my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!  Clear and brilliant pictures
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera; takes beautiful and clear pictures. There are many settings and filters to learn. I am new at using this kind of camera, but it is easy to learn without reading the entire book. If you are looking for a great camera with many settings, filters and takes clear photos then look no further. The only thing I wish I would have purchased at the same time was the 55-200mm lens because the 18-55mm lens (that comes with it) doesn't have any telephoto or real close up view. I have ordered the additional lens.
customer_reviews.author: Mom to Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Small, but very powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera refurbished, and it works perfectly! I also have use an older Nikon D80. Compared to the d80 (should apply to the new D7000/7100 too), the D5200 feels more "plasticky" and hollow. Performance-wise, the camera is remarkable. It's definitely the one to beat for a while. Both photos and videos look beautiful, and the screen interface is simple and a treat to look at. Raw files can get a little large, though (~36mb), but with a good SD card, this shouldn't be much of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera, my first real DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera, my first real DSLR. I've learned a ton. This takes great pictures and is really easy to use. It's on the smaller side, I have giant hands, but it's nice to tote around all day. Highly recommended. The WMU sucks, but its a nice feature if you have patience. I bought with the the 18-105mm, since I've added a 35mm 1.8 and a 14MM. I do not use the video function at all, so I can't really comment, but the tilt/swivel screen is helpful for viewing on a tripod and tough angle shots. So if you're looking for a decently priced "entry level" DSLR, grab one!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for amateur photographer looking to take amazing photos!
customer_reviews.text: I am upgrading from the Nikon D40 and I found that the D5300 was very easy to use and it has the no flash feature which works great in lower light scenarios. The stock lens is just right in size and ability to take your everyday shots. I find that the feel of the camera is just right and I don't notice it being to bulky or too small for an SLR (The D40 seemed to be a bit small for my larger hands). The speed and quality of the shots form this camera are outstanding and I am very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: K. Kendziora

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, great pictures!
customer_reviews.text: Everything i was hoping for in a camera. I am still learning some of the settings but have been using at my kids sporting events and the pictures are unbelievable. I have taken pictures with this camera while my wife uses our point and shoot and the pictures are just way better. The detail and clarity is amazing. The best way to describe is the point and shot is like watching regular TV while the pic from this camera are like HD TV. If you are thinking about getting a DSLR I strongly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a big upgrade from my old D80. I wanted video capability and more megapixels. I got it in this camera! The extra bonus is the mode dial with the Special Effects Modes. This is fun. The monitor is very handy, especially if you wear reading glasses. The camera is easy to operate, but with a large lens you need a tripod to shoot video. I love this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Appletje

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite cameras. I also have a Nikon D600. The D5200 is a bit lighter, but does have a smaller sensor than the D600. I don't find the D5200 lacking in quality or features. I also like the swivel screen, though I don't use it much. I do like keep it closed with the screen on the inside so I don't smudge it a lot with my nose. This is a really nice camera. I buy the Tameron 18-270mm lens for it and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Landscape, Wildlife Photogragher
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this camera for a short time this winter. So far I am very satisfied with the layout of the controls, the light weight of the camera and quality photo's I have taken so far. As the weather gets better and I use the camera more I might be able to rate it higher. I traded my D3200 for this camera and I believe the D5200 turns on faster and is much easier to focus under some conditions. I would say you can't hardly go wrong with this camera for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jack M Seaman

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: After much research I settled on purchasing the D5200 in favor of the D5300 and do not regret the decision. It's a great camera that's easy to use, packed with features and produces amazing quality images. It will take a while to master the features, as the manual is pretty close in size to the bible, but if you are looking for quality images with minimal post-processing, then this camera is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Stillard

customer_reviews.title: I honestly love the camera
customer_reviews.text: I honestly love the camera. I am still very entry level and got this deal few months ago. Every time I used it, it has been great. Still getting hang of when to use what settings and lenses. My only issue would be when using the screen for menu, the timeout is very fast and I dont know how to get it to come back without turning it off and on again. Also the difficulty(For me anyway) to convert their file format of RAW to another format.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Poor fps
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for single shot but in high release mode it slowed after two frames and stopped after 5 shots. Other than the small issue all was good. It was exactly as advertised and arrived as promised
customer_reviews.author: William Neal Porter 3

customer_reviews.title: Still love it
customer_reviews.text: I had this camera 5 years ago and had to return it due to the price (1400.00$) but now that's it's far more affordable I've purchased it again and I love it.... it's just as awesome as I remember! Everything about this camera is perfect for the beginner. Has enough bells and whistles to be used for advanced photography but isn't so complicated that you have to be an expert to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful pictures! Family and friends are amazed how beautiful ...
customer_reviews.text: I decided to treat myself to this camera 3yrs ago, I still take it everywhere I go, use it every chance I get, has been in all kinds of weather from the rain in the mountains to sandy beaches and snowy weather. Beautiful pictures! Family and friends are amazed how beautiful my photos are.
customer_reviews.author: Kara Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This camera had one of the best rated sensors under $1000 by DXO mark
customer_reviews.text: This camera had one of the best rated sensors under $1000 by DXO mark. it's interesting for video since it can take almost any nikon lens including vintage ones that don't work with other new Nikon DSLR's. I use old lenses with manual focus and aperture, which give you a lot of control. In this case it helps to have a viewfinder attachment to see the lcd in daylight . The Xit XTLCDMVL with 3.4X Magnification works well for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Emilio1000

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for entry/mid grade dslr!
customer_reviews.text: This thing takes amazing pictures for the price. Beware generic batteries as I have found the Nikon to hold a better charge unfortunately, but just as we'll could buy a few generics and carry with you! Also I had to get a faster SD card so there Wasn't as much delay. Google how to use it and check out the "ken" tutorials. His page has helped me greatly!
customer_reviews.author: F. Cotton

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great for everyday stuff and even some pro stuff. Durable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Wildlife Up Close

customer_reviews.title: I then ordered it from Amazon and was completely happy with the shipping and the product
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I was scammed buying this camera from a online company called the digitalpros. I then ordered it from Amazon and was completely happy with the shipping and the product. This is a great camera at a good price. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Great kit for the intermediate photographer!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for blog and freelance photography and this kit was an excellent buy. My photos come out to 6000x4000 resolution and they are gorgeous. I also film HD 1080p video with this and the quality is superb. The kit is a great buy to get two lenses, one standard portrait and one zoom lens. I highly recommend this kit to any intermediate level photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly B.

customer_reviews.title: Beginner Photographer
customer_reviews.text: I love my camera, I take it everywhere with me. I am somewhat of a beginner and was worried about the complication of the new camera (I had a D40 previous to this camera). I feel once I gain more confidence in my skills, I will shoot a lot more. There are many functions on this camera I have not yet utilized, but until I get manual completely down, the other functions will have to wait. I am very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TStar

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for anyone wanting ready to transition out of amateur status
customer_reviews.text: Sharp images, easy to use, versatile.. Only two drawbacks. It's really easy to accidentally reformat your SD card by accident if you don't go to another function in the menu after reformatting and I can't use the rangefinder on full manual lens when shooting with lenses that use the hyper (super?) sonic, auto focus motor. Not a real problem when shooting low-light, just switch to aperture priority, but a a little irritating with studio flash systems when i want full control over everything.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: Still use it today, but there are better ones only because they release a new version every year but that's tech. I still use it because it's with today's advances if it looks good now it will for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Nicola

customer_reviews.title: Nice for a first DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Still learning how to use it other than automatic mode, but it takes great pictures and was a great deal. Perfect for a beginner. I am just a mom taking pics of my kids and family, but it takes really nice pics. I really like macro mode. Excited to have it for years to come. It replaced a cybershot point and shoot that was about eight years old! Definitely an improvement!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this Camera. One of the best investments I have made yet.
customer_reviews.author: Dean J. Moore

customer_reviews.title: and it didn't take long to fall in love with this one
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to film Youtube videos. It's been years since I have owned a Nikon DSLR, and it didn't take long to fall in love with this one. This is a smaller, prosumer camera, but packs a punch with image quality and HD video. I couldn't be happier with the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrold

customer_reviews.title: This rating is not for the product per se, ...
customer_reviews.text: This rating is not for the product per se, but for the product package that was delivered to me. Had to return it as it didnt come with any warranty information or serial number, and Nikon refused to extend warranty if I couldn't provide a serial number.
customer_reviews.author: Guha

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Use this thing everyday! Love it! It takes great crystal clear photos if you know how to use the camera correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Dj

customer_reviews.title: High Shutter Count
customer_reviews.text: The camera I received seems in perfect condition with no cosmetic or functional issues. My only concern is with the shutter count. Mine came with a shutter count of 6324. Is that reasonable to expect from a factory refurbished camera? I expected little or no use. I will keep it though. A replacement might be less desirable or less perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera and kit!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife and she is overjoyed with it. The level of gadgets and options are amazing and she is constantly taking pictures in our yard and other events. The lenses come with sun shades that screw onto the lens itself for storage and use. The wireless option is awesome, but has not been fully implemented yet. Definitely a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flash didn't last a year
customer_reviews.text: Less than a year in and the flash completely stopped working while in Hawaii. I had been very happy with the camera and lens package up to this point but now I am stuck trying to figure out how to get it fixed all the while indoor family activities are going on. Disappointing but I had reservations about a built in flash going in.
customer_reviews.author: SWestlake

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D5200 or D3200 ?
customer_reviews.text: D5200 is a really nice camera... Althought it is not a super pro, It is a really nice entry-mid level and if you know how to use it properly, you could achieve awesome results. I have had the D5100 and the D3200, and the D5200 have several improvements against them that I would definetly recommended. If you only take pictures for fun, I would recommend you to get the D3200 the quality is it almost the same. of course d5200 is better is several ways and have more functions... but D3200 it is a great deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: H. F. SANDOVAL

customer_reviews.title: A very good camera
customer_reviews.text: I liked the Nikon D3200 a lot so when I saw the D5200 at a great price I got it. This model has better af with 39 points it uses for the af. I got one without a lens as I have extra lenses. Body only cameras are best if you want more than the kit lense offers.
customer_reviews.author: KSArnold

customer_reviews.title: Decided to upgrade to this nikon D5200 and so far I haven't been anything else than satisfied. It takes wonderful pictures and i
customer_reviews.text: I had my nikon D60 for 8 years when it suddenly stopped working. Decided to upgrade to this nikon D5200 and so far I haven't been anything else than satisfied. It takes wonderful pictures and is easy to use. I think it is a good camera for both pros but also for amateurs. The details are quite the same as on the D60, but of course the D5200 has much much more on it. Nikon has never let me down, and hopefully it stays that way.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: My love, and I'm officially a Nikon follower now
customer_reviews.text: My love, and I'm officially a Nikon follower now. Did TONS and TONS of research before my purchase. Though Canon T3i may be faster (I could be wrong, tested it once while shooting sports for my gym as the event photographer), this is a better overall value.
customer_reviews.author: Aurelia

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera and have been using this particular package ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera and have been using this particular package for years. I've taken this camera all over the U.S. and abroad to Asia and have not had any issues. I love my Nikon!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome camera. It was between this or the canon rebel T5i. It's not cumbersome to operate. In fact my wife is terrible with tech items and she finds it simple to use and loves it. If you have kids in sports/activities the rapid fire option is great. Beware you will take a lot of pics so make sure you have a large SD card and hard drive. We also bought the extra lens for long shots and it was a little expense but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy, but Nikon should re-visit the grip design
customer_reviews.text: After several years with the Nikon D-50 I upgraded to D5200. Love it! Honestly, there is only one thing I dislike: From a perspective of ergonomics, I strongly prefer the design and the way the right-hand grip and controls work on the D50 to those on the newer D5200. I brought my D50 to a store, compared both, and my wife and I were both surprised the newer model just isn't as comfortable as the earlier model. But all the new features, the larger screen, the higher megapixels of the newer model convinced us we'd get over the ergonomics.
customer_reviews.author: AZgoodbooks

customer_reviews.title: One of the best entry level DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Shoots great videos and superb pictures depending on the lens attached. Idk if mine is faulty or not but the screen keeps turning off regularly
customer_reviews.author: Jerald E Kanhai

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera, great for those who want more options when shooting
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera! It takes a bit to learn the ins and outs but is a wonderful camera for a mid-level user whose ready to move on from their first digital camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. I have taken some wonderful pictures with ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. I have taken some wonderful pictures with it. I'm by no means a great photographer, but this sure makes it a lot easier to get good photos than a point and shoot! having raw files and so much control can add personal touches to your photography.
customer_reviews.author: Deth

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: Shipped ahead of the expected delivery date, works exactly as it should. I already have this camera but picked up a second for video work, identical performance.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm no photography pro but I purchased this after playing around with my best friend's Nikon D5100. 6 months later I'm still in love. This camera is everything I wanted and more. It's true to all the specs given, I've had no issues with it so far. Hoping all my future purchases of Nikon will be just as good!
customer_reviews.author: Faith N

customer_reviews.title: and actually was a great buy.
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived on time, and actually was a great buy.... but the only thing I realized is that not all items in the order were included and I had to ask for a refund and am planning to buy a new dslr... Nikon d5300 instead of d5200.... The performance of the dslr is just awesome... beyond my expectations
customer_reviews.author: KGenus7

customer_reviews.title: Excited to have a quality camera!
customer_reviews.text: I'm still learning to use my new D5200 but so far, everything has worked great. Pics are very clear and I've become a shutter-bug again. Can't wait to try this out in low light conditions when we go to Cosumel this December. My wife got me the Nikon D5200 For Dummies book so I can teach myself how to use this camera to full advantage.
customer_reviews.author: CLEVE

customer_reviews.title: Love mine.
customer_reviews.text: No need to put in lengthy review as there are hundreds. This is a great camera if you are looking to move up to a pretty decent dslr and possibly take photography a bit more serious. If this is in your price range and you're on the fence, don't be, this camera is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: mark hammond

customer_reviews.title: I feel like I'm not quite advanced enough when confronting the amount ...
customer_reviews.text: This model (now discontinued) has been described as an advanced beginners camera. I feel like I'm not quite advanced enough when confronting the amount of technology it has. Performs great in the auto modes. slightly smaller and considerably lighter than a "full-sized" DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: OMG I love it.
customer_reviews.text: My previous camera was a 2000 Olympus 5 MP. So when I bought the D5100 last year I was totally amazed at the improvement. I loved it so much when the D5200 came out I bought it and gave my D5100 to my daughter. The 24MP is even better. You can crop till you drop and it is still an amazing photo. The new graphics are great too.
customer_reviews.author: Garry D. Kepley

customer_reviews.title: Best camera for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best camera for beginners, i shoot amzeing shot with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: vikas B.

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: While it may not be best suited for complete beginners, picture quality is great, and there is a lot to work with right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I will not pretend I know anything at all about a good camera. We use this to take pictures of our family and nature. Our lives. It is a beautiful camera. Some of the best images we have ever seen have come out of this camera. It has an amazingly fast shutter. You can edit your picture right on the camera. I would buy it again if I needed another. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little Nikon!
customer_reviews.text: Most value for your money, Clarity, professional features, great little camera, pair it with some good lenses and you will be so happy you did not spend money on some of the costlier SLR's. Great camera for beginners and photo enthusiasts alike
customer_reviews.author: Prad..The Gadget Man

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: Best entry level camera out there. It has every thing you need without adding a lot of bells and whistles that are only good for bragging rights.
customer_reviews.author: D. Livingston

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Amateur/Intermediate Photographer
customer_reviews.text: Best present to myself ever. Everything came brand new and works wonderfully. The camera bag was a nice bonus, especially since it is well made. I'm an amateur photographer with some design experience and this camera is great for the occasional needs I have in terms of photographing family events and my artwork.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: I've loved working with this camera every moment that I've had ...
customer_reviews.text: I've loved working with this camera every moment that I've had it. Nikon menu systems are so streamlined, and the grip/size are comfortable for any working situation. Obviously, it isn't full frame, which is the biggest downfall, but for the price, the photo and video capabilities offered by the D5200 are spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M Schildgen

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the wife. Very good camera with a decent zoom lens. Easy to use, and there's tons of features on it. Definitely not a pro photographer, but this takes some seriously good pictures. Flash is pretty decent for stock, but if you plan on taking a lot of low light pics, might want an additional flash.
customer_reviews.author: Erich A. Mabray

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great camera but a little complex unless you know what you are doing
customer_reviews.author: Colton R

customer_reviews.title: and has more useful features than most users will ever use
customer_reviews.text: Prosumer" cameras have come a long way. I will begin with the end: the D5200 is a superb offering that will do as much as almost all non-professional users will ever need it to do, and has more useful features than most users will ever use. There are many competing cameras at or near this price ...
customer_reviews.author: Abeysinghe

customer_reviews.title: My Go-To Video Camera
customer_reviews.text: I've made a slew of in-studio videos with this puppy - using the included kit lens. It delivers a very nice product. Have never used it as a camera. The sound is excellent with an auxiliary mic. Only complaint may be the lack of headphone plug.
customer_reviews.author: Dezi Beck

customer_reviews.title: My Canon T2i did far better on a recent Carnival shoot in semi-cloudy conditions
customer_reviews.text: This camera is so complicated that it comes with an 89 page manual. My Canon T2i did far better on a recent Carnival shoot in semi-cloudy conditions. The Nikon metered for the sky instead of the subjects. What is the point of the "Effects" option? I have computers to do effects. All I need is aperture, shutter speed, ISO, and auto focus. I don't need a micro processor to do my thinking for me, especially when it get the answer wrong. The auto focus is also unreliable. Why the camera focused on the background instead of the subjects is beyond me. I guess I'll have to read pages 28-31.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald W. Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful photographs with more potential than I can yet use
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful photographs with more potential than I can yet use. As an amateur I MUST take some classes for the full benefit of this camera. I sought advice from a couple of professionals and they simply said "get it". The price break and set up is better than others I checked.
customer_reviews.author: Olddiver

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera. Great price
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I have wanted a DSLR for many years but could not afford until this one came along. Fantastic photos, easy to use and just plain fun. I am so happy with my choice and would highly recommend to anyone looking for a more affordable and amazing camera!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Entry level DSLR
customer_reviews.text: It has been a few weeks since I got this DSLR and I am totally impressed. I debated for a while between the D3300 and this D5200. What it came down for me was shooting my kids in their various sports activities. The D5200 has done a remarkable job at this so far with my daughter's swim meets and my son's basketball games. Having more focus points has made a difference. Happy to have this camera as my entry level DSLR. Looking forward to learning the ends and outs of digital photography with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: V. Gamble

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: This is an all around great camera. You can go to any website that reviews cameras and get all the details that I can't put here, but I love it and use it all the time. Great for anyone whether they are a pro or a beginner. Has lots of options and features.
customer_reviews.author: Karen G.

customer_reviews.title: Meets All Expectations!
customer_reviews.text: It's an excellent product! I purchase the 18-105 millimeter lens just before I left to study in Europe. The image quality is extremely good! It's also very good at focusing in or out on different objects and either blurring or highlighting the foreground or background. It's also very manual-use friendly, so it can be played with. Of course, it might be a little much for an unexperienced photographer. However, if you know what you're doing, it can be a lot of fun to use!
customer_reviews.author: Bennett

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS CAMERA!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Can take great photos and is super affordable. The articulating screen is such a help, and 90% of the photos that I take are in complete focus. The video mode is great, but 20 minutes seems a bit limited. Just wish it had a touchscreen and came with more than one battery.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Cena

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I shot one event, about 400 photos, and when I came home I was pleasantly surprised to find very little editing was necessary. All the shots were superb. But I need to find some time to explore ALL the camera's features. There are just not enough hours in the day for me!
customer_reviews.author: P. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great kit for beginners to advanced!
customer_reviews.text: All in one package right here!!! Purchased as a gift for Christmas and was very impressed with most everything it came with. I will however say that I am not a fan of the case. I prefer one that can zip up completely, not just buckle. All in all a very well put together kit!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box this camera is very pretty. I was a bit surprised and panicked a little bit when I turned it on and the language was set to Japanese though. Luckily it was easy enough to find the language section and change it to English. Great camera and I have had so much fun taking pictures all over South Carolina.
customer_reviews.author: Midastuch78

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera and quality of the images it takes. Came with a cable that wasn't even for the camera, so I had to buy a new one to sync my camera with my laptop, that was annoying. Other than that, great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Harshfield

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with camera so far
customer_reviews.text: Although listed as non VR lenses, the lenses I received were VR capable. This my first Digital SLR, so reading through the operation instructions to see how and what the different settings are for. The only other digital cameras I have owned were the point and shoot variety. I do have some back ground in 35mm film cameras, and figured this would be an adventurous upgrade. Very pleased with camera so far.
customer_reviews.author: William E. Haynes II

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great first dslr! the movable screen is also a plus to get "complex angle" photos!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera lots of features almost too many
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera lots of features almost too many. It would take me a year to learn all the features and how to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have locally taken some excellent pictures. I also like the lens available for ...
customer_reviews.text: New to the DSLR camara. Finally put away enough to get one. I chose the D5200 and as far as I can tell it works for me. I have locally taken some excellent pictures. I also like the lens available for the DSLR camaras. To be a lens for every occation. It was an article by a professional that convinced me to go with the DSLR D5200, I had been observing many models. So yes I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Giles Massey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal. Love my camera
customer_reviews.text: Awesome deal. Love my camera. The bag it comes with is pretty bulky and would not take it with me to travel. DVD crash course was straight forward and was not lengthy at all. It did give some good pointers.
customer_reviews.author: A&C MERC

customer_reviews.title: I had one before so I know it how good it is
customer_reviews.text: I had one before so I know it how good it is. I don't need touch screen so it was a no brainer for me. Awesome, awesome camera. Yes, the body could be built more professionally but than the price would increase as well. I love it to pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Duldulao

customer_reviews.title: D5200 has become my favorite!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a replacement backup for my D5000, for school. D5200 has become my favorite !
customer_reviews.author: K. Fleetwood

product_meta.title: Nikon D5200 24.1 MP CMOS Digital SLR Camera Body Only (Black)
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Style:Body Only| Configuration:BaseFROM THE MANUFACTURER



Transforming everyday sights into images that move us.
Shooting photos and videos is about more than capturing memories. A great camera brings your creative vision to life with striking clarity. The Nikon D5200 is exactly that type of camera—an exceptional HD-SLR designed to draw exciting new perspectives out of everyone who shoots it. Optimized for creativity, streamlined for flexibility, it'll awaken your passion and inspire some of the most spectacular photos and videos you've ever captured.






SHOWCASE YOUR ARTISTRY
VARI-ANGLE DISPLAY, BUILT-IN HDR, SPECIAL EFFECTS AND FILTERS
Creativity and flexibility were considered in every aspect of the D5200. It has a 921,000-dot Vari-angle display that lets you shoot from just about any position—hold the camera overhead for a view above a crowd, at ground level for an interesting close-up of a flower, or just enjoy easier video recording and self portraits. For shots that have both very dark and very bright areas, D5200 includes built-in HDR (high-dynamic range). It takes two shots at different exposures and blends them into one amazing image. And an exciting collection of built-in effects and filters opens new possibilities for expression: isolate a single color, explore black & white, posterize, miniaturize—the creative techniques pros spend years mastering are now conveniently at your command.

CAPTURE LIFE'S BRILLIANCE
24.1 MP DX-FORMAT CMOS SENSOR AND RENOWNED NIKKOR LENSES
Perhaps your greatest inspiration will be the spectacular quality of every photo and video you shoot with the D5200. Its highly sensitive 24.1-megapixel DX-format CMOS image sensor captures your vision with lifelike brilliance—marvel at the vibrant colors and razor-sharp detail, even in low light. Legendary NIKKOR lenses, marvels of clarity and quality, are the perfect companion for the D5200, drawing peak performance out of the sensor. Our intelligent Scene Recognition System compares your shot against an onboard database for optimum exposure, and EXPEED 3, the processing power in our acclaimed D4, makes it all happen in an instant.

SHARE YOUR CREATIONS IN AN INSTANT
OPTIONAL WU-1A WIRELESS ADAPTER FOR WI-FI PHOTO SHARING AND CAMERA CONTROL
The thrill of creating a great photo is topped only by the excitement of sharing it. With the D5200, you'll have many great photos to share, so we made it easy. Just add the optional WU-1a Wireless Mobile Adapter and instantly transfer your shots to a smartphone or tablet via Wi-Fi. Then share your favorites online as usual: email them, upload them to your favorite social networks or photo-sharing site like Nikon's my Picturetown. You can even use your smartphone or tablet as an external “live view” monitor to see what the camera sees and fire the shutter—perfect for getting into photos instead of always shooting them.

Note: These functions require an Android or iOS device and Nikon's free Wireless Mobile Adapter Utility app, available on Google Play and the iTunes App Store.



TAKE YOUR VISION TO VIDEO
HIGH-QUALITY FULL HD (1080P) VIDEO RECORDING CAPABILITIES
The D5200 includes Nikon's latest innovations for creating beautiful videos with virtually no choppiness. D-Movie mode now features Full HD 1080p 60i for visibly smoother sequences, a first for Nikon HD-SLRs. Full-time-servo AF (AF-F) and subject-tracking AF work together to keep moving subjects sharp and in focus, and face-priority AF instantly detects and tracks up to 35 faces in a scene. D5200 also has a built-in stereo microphone that can be controlled automatically or manually via 20 incremental steps, another first for Nikon HD-SLRs. Whether you shoot short clips or cinema-style movies, the D5200 makes it easy to take your projects to the next level.



PREMIUM ACCESSORIES
EN-EL14 Rechargeable Li-ion Battery 
These rechargeable batteries provide extended life and consistent power, even in colder conditions. ME-1 Stereo Microphone 
Record crystal-clear sound and significantly reduce autofocus noise on your compatible DSLR camera using this compact stereo microphone. The ME-1 Stereo Microphone connects to compatible DSLR cameras that have a 3.5mm Mic jack and features new innovation that significantly reduces autofocus noise from being recorded. WU-1a Wireless Mobile Adapter 
Using the WU-1a optional wireless mobile adapter you can now automatically send great images to your smartphone and even use your smartphone to remotely capture images from your D5200. With an easy to use app, now when you can't wait to share that great shot you don't have to. Share it to your smartphone in a instant. ML-L3 Wireless Remote Control (Infrared) 
Enables wireless remote shutter release. Trigger the shutter remotely when using slower shutter speeds to prevent camera movement. 

Download the user manual.
feature_bullets: 39-point (9 cross type) dynamic area AF system with 3D tracking
Up to 5 frames per second continuous shooting
1080p 30FPS HD video (1080p, 60i) with full-time contrast-detect AF
Wi-Fi (for sharing and remote camera control) and GPS compatible (sold separately)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars749 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
